page.title: 06Fordingbridge-Vimoutiers.
page.content: {Fordingbridge}and its surrounding villages completed its formal twinning with{Vimoutiers}in the Department of Orne, France, during the weekend of 29th and 30th May, 1982.(The first ceremony having taken place in Vimoutiers in 1981.){The Twinning {Ceremony}takes place to create friendship and to bring together people who have different traditions and a way of life perhaps not quite like our own. Vimoutiers is a town of similar size, being situated on a river, and not far from the coast. Both towns have a similar number of inhabitants. Vimoutiers is less than 18 miles from Falaise, the birthplace of{William the Conqueror. After three years of discussion and visits to each other's countries, the Twinning weekend became one of carnival and gaiety, all of which took
